entry.title: SAP CPQ 2511 - Scripting for Custom Quote Actions & Quote Item Custom Fields Access Control
entry.content:
This blog introduces the scripting enhancements in SAP CPQ 2511, tested and verified in my pre-release version. The scripting examples provided here are optimized for implementation and serve as a valuable resource for CPQ developers, functional consultants, and integration specialists seeking for practical guidance.

Special thanks to Nikola & Pavithran for upgrading to 2511 for pre-release testing

Follow for more updates from  : Yogananda Muthaiah

Dynamic Access Control for Quote Item Custom Fields

Access level permissions on Quote Item Custom Fields can now be dynamically set through scripting in Quote 2.0. This feature allows users to control the editability, read-only status, and visibility of fields, enhancing customization and security in managing quotes.

Here's an example script:

from Scripting.Quote import QuoteFieldAccessLevel

for item in context.PagedItems:
    QuoteFieldAccessContext.SetAccessLevel(item, 'TargetPrice', QuoteFieldAccessLevel.Hidden)
    QuoteFieldAccessContext.SetAccessLevel(item, 'TargetPrice', QuoteFieldAccessLevel.Hidden)
    QuoteFieldAccessContext.SetAccessLevel(item, 'TargetPrice', QuoteFieldAccessLevel.Hidden)


eachItem = context.Quote.GetItemByItemNumber(1)
QuoteFieldAccessContext.SetAccessLevel(eachItem, 'TargetPrice', QuoteFieldAccessLevel.ReadOnly)  

QuoteFieldAccessContext.SetColumnAccessLevel('TargetPrice', QuoteFieldAccessLevel.ReadOnly)


QuoteFieldAccessContext.SetAccessLevelForProductType(39, 'TargetPrice', QuoteFieldAccessLevel.ReadOnly)

QuoteFieldAccessContext.SetAccessLevelForSection('ProductType', 'TargetPrice', QuoteFieldAccessLevel.Editable)

QuoteFieldAccessContext.SetAccessLevelForCartTotal
  

Executing Custom Quote Actions via Scripting

As of the 2511 release, you can execute custom quote actions in Quote 2.0 within the Workflow context through scripting.

The SAP CPQ system checks all the permissions and conditions defined in the Workflow for these actions to ensure that only available custom quote actions are executed. For each available action, the system performs pre-actions and post-actions and sends notifications. The list of available custom quote actions is also returned in scripting.

Here's an example script:

 
customQuoteactionAvailable = WorkflowExecutor.IsActionAvailableForQuote(3102, context.Quote.Id)
WorkflowExecutor.ExecuteActionOnQuote(3102, context.Quote.Id)

 

Enhanced ExtenalItemID Editing via API and Scripting

As of 2511 release, extenalItemID can be edited, updated and accessed through API and scripting. This enhancement enables more flexible and efficient data management and integration scenarios.

to enable ExternalItemId to be changed from the Scripting

Here's an example script:

Items = context.Quote.GetAllItems()
Items[0].ExternalItemId = 'Testing from Yoga to update ExternalItemId '

Trace.Write(Items[0].ExternalItemId)

Improved RestClient Methods for Decompressed Responses

RestClients previously returned unreadable strings for compressed responses. To address this issue and support the decompression of the response body for compressed responses using Gzip or Deflate compression methods, a new decompressResponse parameter was added. By default, it is set to False, maintaining current functionality.

Setting it to True automatically decompresses responses into readable JSON, allowing users to handle compressed responses without changing existing calls unless needed.

Here's an example script:

authorization_token = RestClient.GetBasicAuthenticationHeader("YMUTHAIAH", "XXXXXXXXXXXXXXX")
headers = { "Authorization": authorization_token}
token_url = "https://XXXXXXXXX.de1.demo.crm.cloud.sap/sap/c4c/api/v1/iam-service/token"
token = RestClient.Get(token_url,headers )
 
aa = token.value.access_token
 
url = "https://XXXXXXXXX.de1.demo.crm.cloud.sap/sap/c4c/api/v1/document-service/documents/"
headers1 = { "Authorization": "Bearer " + str(aa),
           'Accept': 'application/json; charset=UTF-8'}
 
json_body = {
    'isSelected':'false',
    'isDisplayDocument':'true',
    'fileName': 'CPQ-Document.xlsx',
    'category': 'DOCUMENT',
    'type': '10001'
}
 
newdata=JsonHelper.Deserialize(JsonHelper.Serialize(json_body))
response = RestClient.Post(url, newdata, headers1, True)

 

Script Fix for Quote 2.0 Alternatives

The IronPython script issue in Quote 2.0, where newly added alternative items were incorrectly flagged and excluded from calculations, has been resolved.

This fix ensures accurate total and product type calculations, making it essential for users who rely on scripting to manage quote alternatives efficiently.

Here's an example script:

quote = QuoteHelper.Get("00021088")
item = quote.GetItemByItemNumber(1)
altProduct = ProductHelper.CreateProduct('00021088',item.QuoteItem)
alternativeItem = quote.AddItem(altProduct,1).AsMainItem
alternativeItem.ChangeItemTypeToAlternative(item.Id)

entry.title: Unlocking Visibility with “No Correlation” feature in Process Visibility
entry.content:
Introduction

In today’s fast-paced business world, not every process follows a straight path, or even connects at all. Yet, enterprises still need end-to-end visibility.

Enter SAP’s powerful capability in Process Visibility: the “No Correlation” feature.

Whether you’re managing HR workflows or procurement cycles, this feature offers flexibility to monitor and analyze non-correlated processes together — all within a single dashboard.

 

Why Does “No Correlation” feature Matter?

Not all business processes are tightly linked. Many operate in parallel within the same business domain but have no direct interaction.

Example:

  • Hiring vs. Retirement
  • Promotion vs. Equipment Provisioning

They all fall under Human Resources, yet they function independently. Still, business leaders need visibility across all these activities, ideally through one Visibility Scenario dashboard.

That’s exactly what Process Visibility's “No Correlation” feature enables.

 

Building the Foundation: Process Groups

SAP Process Visibility lets you group processes - correlated or non-correlated into Process Groups for better monitoring.

Two main configurations:

  1. Correlated Processes (e.g., Hiring ↔ Equipment Provisioning)
    • Processes are connected in sequence.
    • Define connections between them within a process group.
  2. Non-Correlated Processes (e.g., Promotion Change, Retirement)
    • Processes run independently but still need unified tracking.
    • Create separate process groups and map common attributes to view them cohesively.

Note: A default Process Group is automatically created. You can edit or create new ones depending on your scenario.

 

Step-by-Step: Enabling Non-Correlated Process Tracking

  • Adding Process Participants:

In your Visibility Scenario Editor → Processes tab → Add the processes that need to either be correlated or not correlated, as process participants.

In this example, we have created a Visibility Scenario for HR Department. We are adding 4 processes as process participants – Hiring, Promotion Change, Retirement and Equipment Provisioning. In this scenario, Hiring and Equipment Provisioning are related processes, while Promotion Change and Retirement are independent processes.

  • Enable the No Correlation Feature

As we have processes that are not correlated, we will have to enable this feature.
In your Visibility Scenario Editor → General tab → Enable “Visibility Scenario to Include Non-Correlated Processes”

This unlocks side-by-side tracking of independent workflows.

  • Create Process Groups

Note: A default Process Group is automatically created with all the process participants. You can edit or create new ones depending on your scenario.

Example:

In this example, the default process group is updated with Hiring and Equipment Provisioning processes. As the process group contains more than one process, a connection is defined for these processes.

Then we create 2 process groups:

  • One group for Promotion Change
  • Another for Retirement

These are the independent process that are not related. For the individual processes, new process groups are created, one for each process. As there is only one process in each of these process groups, there no need to define the connection type.

 

  • Map Attributes for Unified Tracking

Once you’ve created process groups for your non-correlated processes, the next step is to unify how you view them. You can do them in the Attributes -> Context tab

Choose Map Attributes to map the attributes of the processes across process groups:

In the Map Attributes dialog box, select the Source Attribute and the Mapped Attribute from the drop-down list. You can map shared attributes like Employee ID or Department etc., The source attributes will then be visible in the Visibility Scenario Instances application and the Mapped Attributes are hidden.

You can choose Add Attribute button to map more attributes.

Choose Save.

This ensures all mapped attributes appear cohesively in your Visibility Scenario Instances application.

  • Finally release and deploy.

 

Business Value

Streamlined Monitoring: See all relevant processes, even if unlinked - in one dashboard.
Accurate Insights: Focus on meaningful groupings, not rigid process chains.
Scalability: Easily manage hybrid landscapes of connected and standalone processes.

 

Final Thoughts

The “No Correlation” feature in SAP Process Visibility is more than a technical enhancement, it’s a strategic enabler.
It empowers organizations to track and optimize processes the way they truly operate, not just how systems connect them.

Whether your workflows are integrated, hybrid, or standalone, SAP Process Visibility ensures you never lose sight of what matters most: business outcomes!

entry.title: want to know how to use this website
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I am currently learning and working on SAP ABAP, but I often face a problem when trying to find related blogs or step-by-step solutions on SAP Community.

Even when I search, I get multiple blogs that are not in sequence, or sometimes I can’t figure out which one is the correct or latest approach. Because of this, I often get stuck when I try to solve real-time issues.

For example, I want to learn Smart Forms, but I don’t know how to search and how to find the blogs in a proper sequence. In fact, when I face a problem, I don’t always know how to search on Google regarding that specific issue.

Thank you in advance for your help and suggestions.

Best regards,

entry.title: Re: Frontend Strategies for SAP Sales Cloud V2: An Architect’s Perspective on Modern UI Extensions
entry.content:
Hi @showkath_naseem,

thank you very much for the very detailed and helpful blog post.

I am currently working intensively on implementing enhancements for SAP Sales and Service Cloud V2.

Our customers want a uniform UI. Enhancements should integrate seamlessly into the standard. I completely understand this, and it is also my expectations on my own enhancements.

As you wrote, the Sales/Service Cloud V2 team made the design decision not to follow the Fiori design guidelines. This makes the development of extensions for V2 more complex and inconsistent in terms of the front end.

The SAP Sales and Service Cloud V2 web components are available at https://stage.cxm-salescloud.com/modules/web-components/demo-angular-ui/index.html. I have already used these successfully for prototypes.

  • Is there any reason not to use the V2 web components (with Angular/React)?
  • Could SAP also make this UI library officially available (such as https://github.com/SAP/fundamental-ngx)?

The possibility of using standard SAP Sales and Service Cloud V2 web components for extensions would simplify development on the one hand and ensure a more consistent and user-friendly UI for users on the other.

I would appreciate your feedback on these thoughts.

Thanks and Kind Regards,

Steffen Kollosche

entry.title: Deployment & Distribution Planning with the Production Planning Optimizer (PPO)
entry.content:
In many manufacturing environments, planning needs to stay close to execution. Planners work directly with production progress, short-term material availability, and customer priorities that can change within the same day. The planning horizon is typically short to medium term, with a strong focus on reliable supply, transparent decisions, and fast reaction cycles.

In these situations, SAP S/4HANA with PP/DS often forms the operational planning backbone. It provides real-time insight into production orders, component availability, and resource schedules. When supply spans several plants or distribution points, planners must also decide how available quantities should be best distributed across the network.

This is where deployment planning comes in: balancing service-level priorities, costs, and material constraints, while staying fully integrated with production and execution. 

Note: The approach described here is not an out-of-the-box feature. It represents a project-based solution leveraging the Production Planning Optimizer (PPO) with targeted configuration and some technical enhancements. It is suitable for organizations with a manageable supply network and the capability to implement model- and cost-based planning logic.

Planning Context

  • Planning and scheduling are executed using PP/DS in S/4HANA 
  • Deployment decisions need to be made not only on a daily level, but sometimes multiple times per day, in response to short-term consumption, production progress, or supply fluctuations
  • The supply network spans multiple locations, typically with a manageable number of plants and distribution points rather than a large-scale global network
  • Allocation and distribution decisions need to consider:
  • Availability
  • Priorities
  • Transportation and storage
  • Service-level objectives
  • The goal is to create a balanced and cost-aware deployment plan — using the same planning foundation already established in PP/DS.

Why PPO Works for Deployment

The Production Planning Optimizer is a cost-based optimization engine.
It evaluates alternative decisions and selects the most cost-effective plan under defined constraints.

The same capabilities used for production planning can also model:

  • Inventory allocation across locations

  • Replenishment flows in multi-tier networks
  • Push and pull strategies
  • Priority-based supply distribution
  • Make / transfer / external procurement trade-offs

In other words:

PPO can determine what to produce, where to store it, and how to distribute it — within one integrated model. 

Solution Building Blocks

To use PPO for deployment planning, the following components are modeled:

1. Network and Transportation Structure

  • Sourcing relationships between plants, DCs, or customers
  • Transportation lead times and minimum lot sizes
  • Handling or movement constraints

2. Cost and Priority Framework

  • Storage, transfer, and production costs
  • Late or under-delivery penalties
  • Priority groups or service-level targets

3. Optimizer Profiles and Strategies

  • Solving strategy (heuristic + MIP sequence)
  • Convergence and runtime management
  • Capacity treatment for production and handling steps

4. Optional Enhancements

Depending on the business scenario, selective adjustments can be applied to:

  • Fine-tune cost structures
  • Introduce business-driven priority logic
  • Reflect custom network allocation rules

SAP Consulting provides a ready-to-adopt configuration package, which accelerates implementation and ensures consistent cost scaling and model setup (see SAP Note 3259560).

Example Use Cases

Scenario Description
Supplying several regions from one production siteDetermine optimal shipment quantities and timing.
Distribution with limited inventoryAllocate supply based on service-level / priority targets.
Flexible sourcingOptimize between internal supply, transfers, or external sourcing.

In all cases, the planner remains in the same system (S/4HANA), with direct linkage to production and execution.

Benefits of Keeping Deployment in S/4HANA

  • One system, one data model

  • No additional integration workflows
  • Real-time alignment of production and supply decisions
  • Fast decision loops for operational planning

Conclusion

Deployment and distribution planning can be handled directly in S/4HANA using  PP/DS it's subfunction the Production Planning Optimizer (PPO).
By leveraging its cost-based optimization model, PPO supports balanced and explainable allocation decisions across multiple locations — without requiring a separate planning environment.

This enables a coherent and integrated planning process that stays close to production, keeps data consistent, and supports planners in making informed and efficient supply decisions. 

Further technical details, can be found in: SAP Note 3259560 — Deployment / Distribution Planning with the Production Planning Optimizer (PPO).

entry.title: Streamline Your Migration to SBPA with the ‘No Correlation’ Feature in Process Visibility
entry.content:
Introduction

As businesses modernise their operations, many customers are migrating from SAP Workflow Management to SAP Build Process Automation (SBPA).

This migration is a key step in digital transformation, but it also introduces challenges when processes built on different technologies need to coexist and remain visible together.

That’s where SAP’s “No Correlation” feature in Process Visibility steps in, making it possible to track legacy and new processes in a unified view, without data duplication or reporting disruption.

 

The Migration Challenge

During migration, organisations often face:

  • Technology gaps between BTP Workflow and SAP Build Process Automation [SBPA] processes.
  • Disconnected visibility between legacy and new workflows.
  • Reporting inconsistency when both environments run in parallel.

 

How “No Correlation” Simplifies Migration to SAP Build Process Automation

Let’s say you’ve exported a Visibility Scenario “Insights on Capital Expenditure Process” from SAP Workflow Management and imported it into your SBPA project and you have re-modelled the process “Capital Expenditure Scenario” in SAP Build Process Automation as shown below:

Now, both your legacy Workflow and your newly built SBPA process serve the same business purpose, but run on different technologies.

By enabling “No Correlation” feature, you can:

  • Create separate Process Groups for each process participant (BTP Workflow & SAP Build Process Automation Process).
  • Use attribute mapping to unify common fields (e.g., Request Number, Employee ID etc.,).
  • Achieve a single, unified dashboard view in the Visibility Scenario Instances app.

 

Step-by-Step: Applying “No Correlation” for Migration to SAP Build Process Automation

  • Adding Process Participants:

In your Visibility Scenario Editor, add the Newly Modelled SBPA Process as a Process Participant:

  • Enable the Feature:

In your Visibility Scenario Editor → General tab → Enable “Visibility Scenario to Include Non-Correlated Processes”

  • Create Separate Process Groups
    • One for BTP Workflow from Workflow Management
    • One for SBPA Process
      Both run independently but share the same business context.

Note: A default Process Group is automatically created with all the process participants. You can edit or create new ones depending on your scenario.

  • Map Common Attributes

Under Attributes → Context tab, map shared business fields like Request ID, CAPEX cost, or Employee ID etc.,
This ensures seamless/unified view of both legacy and SBPA processes in a single Process Visibility dashboard.

Now that we have completed the configuration, the Source attributes would appear in the Process Visibility dashboard View and the Mapped attributes would be hidden.

 

Business Impact

Unified Process Visibility: Track historical (BTP Workflows) and new (SBPA processes) in one view.
Smooth Migration: Maintain operational reporting continuity during migration.
No Data Duplication: Map common attributes intelligently for consistent analytics.
Future-Ready Operations: Enable co-existence between multiple automation technologies on SAP BTP.

 

Final Thoughts

The “No Correlation” feature acts as a bridge during migration — helping organisations maintain visibility, accuracy, and performance as they move from SAP Workflow Management to SAP Build Process Automation.

It’s a practical example of how SAP’s intelligent automation tools ensure continuity while paving the way for innovation.

With “No Correlation” feature, you can confidently modernise your process automation landscape without losing sight of your data or insights.

The result is a clean, unified view in the Visibility Scenario Instances dashboard. This allows business users to continue tracking historical and newly migrated processes together, without disrupting reporting or analytics.

entry.title: How to derive dynamic text label in CDS view with value lookup
entry.content:
Background:

Recently I got a requirement to create an account payable aging report which contains dynamic text based on user input, for example, user input aging interval as: 30, 60, 90. in the output of the report, the required report format will be:

CustomerDue in 30 daysDue in 31-60 daysDue in 61-90 daysDue 91+ days
1001$300$600$900$1200

In the traditional SAP BW world, this can be easily achieved by Text variable, however in SAP CDS view, dynamic text is not available in early versions. In my current system version, the version is ABAP 7.58, and it supports this annotation very well.

Solution:

So instead of going this complex scenario, I will use a simple SAP data source:  SFLIGHT to achieve the similar requirement.

Scenario explanation:

There will be only one base measure called Airfare, based on the user input: number of Days X, the output will show the AirFare, X Days AirFare, X+1 Days AirFare, the highlighted two columns text will be dynamically derived based on the user input

Year MonthAirFare10 Days AirFare11 Days AirFare
02.2023$300$600$900

This is how the end to end implementation work look like

  • Define a helper view: this is to return the day + 1

  • Define cube level data model, with base fare, base fare * input days, base fare * input days + 1, the measure if purely for distingush the different dollar value

  • Comes with the fun part, in the query view, we define the parameter which populate the derived dayPlus1 using lookup view which defined in first step:

  • In the measure column, wewill appy the dynamic text using annotation: @Consumption.dynamicLabel:

Now Let's run the CDS view from BW query, as you can see user will be prompt to fill input days (default value is 10):

The measure column will derive the text dynamically based on user input and helper view:

 

With the help to combine annotation @Consumption.dynamicLabel and @Consumption.derivation.lookupEntity, we will be able to achieve the same requirement in the BW world by using Text variable and custom exit. 

I hope this blog give you some help with the how dynamic text can be implemented using SAP CDS view, if you have any questions, please feel free to leave a message.

entry.title: Clean Core SAP TM – Part 1: Avoiding View-Exit Enhancements in the Transportation Cockpit
entry.content:
The Transportation Cockpit is one of the most widely used applications within SAP Transportation Management (TM). Because of its intuitive planning UI, business users often request additional information or custom filters. Traditionally, many customers have met these requirements by implementing view-exit enhancements in Web Dynpro Floorplan Manager (FPM) classes, such as /SCMTMS/CL_UI_VIEWEXIT_PLN_NEW.

However, these implicit enhancements often lead to:

  • Performance issues
  • Increased maintenance effort
  • Upgrade complications
  • Deviation from clean core principles

In this blog, we look at how these enhancements can be avoided using standard SAP TM capabilities — while still meeting business needs.

Why Do Enhancements Commonly Occur?

Enhancements are generally introduced for two purposes:

  1. Displaying additional fields in the Transportation Cockpit
  2. Applying filters based on custom fields

Instead of enhancing the UI layer, SAP TM provides standard mechanisms to achieve both requirements cleanly.

1️⃣Avoid View-Exit Enhancements for Displaying Additional Fields, instead use Field Catalog

If you extend one of the following TOR business object nodes:

  • ROOT
  • STOP
  • STOP_SUCCESSOR
  • ITEM_TR

…using the standard extension include, then the added fields are automatically available in the associated field catalogs. You can then:

  • Adjust labels
  • Set display behavior
  • Enable default visibility

This eliminates the need for view exit coding.

SAP has also significantly expanded the delivered UI structures over time. For example, fields such as Original Order, Order Category, Original Delivery, and Delivery Category are now included by default, removing the need for older enhancement approaches.

Benefits

Benefit

Description

✅Clean Core

Avoids custom coding and simplifies upgrades

✅Reduced TCO

Less maintenance effort and fewer regression risks

✅Better Performance

Fields are retrieved efficiently in the persistence layer

You may refer my colleague @Aleksey_Belskii 's blog on detailed steps for the usage of field catalog.

2️⃣Avoid UI Filtering Enhancements — Use Selection Profile Extensions

Custom filtering is often done by either:

  • Asking planners to manually filter in the UI
  • Implementing filtering logic inside view-exits

Both approaches have drawbacks:

  • UI filters load unnecessary data first → performance impact
  • View-exits → non-clean-core solution

The Standard Solution

SAP TM supports custom fields in Additional Selection Criteria of Selection Profiles — allowing filtering at the query level, not the UI layer.

See SAP Note : 3611306 - Improved enhancement capability in additional selection attributes

Example Scenario

You have added a custom field ZZ_GRP_IND to the ROOT node of the TOR object using enhancement include /SCMTMS/INCL_EEW_TOR_ROOT.  Now you need to enable this field for additional selection criteria- lets do it in two steps.

Step 1 – Append the Custom Field to the Selection Structure

Append structure /SCMTMS/S_TOR_Q_FU_STG_PLN with ZZ_GRP_IND. For FO, use /SCMTMS/S_TOR_Q.

→ The field now appears in the Additional Selection Criteria search help.

Step 2 – Map the Field via Query Enhancement

Use transaction: /SCMTMS/QUERY_ENH

Configure query:

  • Query Name: FU_STAGE_DATA_BY_ATTR
  • Map UI attribute ZZ_GRP_IND → BO node attribute ROOT-ZZ_GRP_IND

→ The system will now include the custom field in selection queries automatically.

Result

  • No UI-layer filtering
  • No custom code
  • Fully upgrade-safe

🎯Conclusion

By leveraging:

  • Field Catalogs, and
  • Selection Profile Query Enhancements

…you can eliminate many commonly seen UI-level enhancements in SAP TM. This approach supports:

  • Clean core architecture
  • Reduced cost of ownership
  • Better system performance
  • Upgrade readiness

This blog is the first in a Clean Core SAP TM series.

More scenarios and practical examples will follow — stay tuned!

entry.title: SAP集成套件概况介绍
entry.content:
如果您对BTP感兴趣，BTP个人精选内容目录 | SAP Blogs 可能有更多你需要的内容

 

SAP集成套件是什么，它从何而来？

SAP集成套件（SAP Integration Suite）是SAP推出的云原生集成平台，诞生于2020年，作为SAP BTP集成能力域的核心组件，专门解决企业应用集成的挑战。它整合了SAP在集成领域的多项技术积累，为混合云时代的企业架构提供统一的集成解决方案。

 

SAP开发集成套件的目的是什么？

1. 应对日益复杂的集成挑战： 现代企业的IT架构越来越复杂，云应用、本地系统、SaaS服务、API接口数量激增。传统的点对点集成方式已经无法应对这种复杂性，维护成本高昂且容易出错。SAP集成套件提供了一个统一的集成平台，将复杂的集成关系简化为星型架构，大幅降低了集成的复杂度和维护成本，同时还帮助用户利用上B2B集成，事件驱动集成等新型集成技术。

 

2. 释放数据价值，打破信息孤岛： 许多企业虽然部署了SAP ERP等核心系统，但数据往往被困在各个独立的应用中，无法形成统一的数据视图。集成套件通过标准化的数据传输和转换能力，帮助企业打通数据流转，让ERP中的核心业务数据能够实时流向BI系统、电商平台、移动应用等，真正实现数据驱动的业务决策。

 

SAP集成套件由什么组成，可以用来干什么？

集成套件的功能主要包括云集成、API管理、B2B集成，事件驱动集成这四块。

集成套件基于云原生架构设计，可以自动根据需求调节资源，保证性能稳定；同时还配备了打通内网的云连接器(SAP Cloud Connector)以实现云与内网的安全对接，以及实现内网到内网集成的边缘集成组件(Edge Integration Cell)，以实现异构网络环境的安全打通

并且，与通用集成平台不同的是，集成套件更懂SAP生态：

  • 预置了数百个SAP应用的连接器和集成模板
  • 内置RFC、IDoc、BAPI等SAP专有协议的支持
  • 提供开箱即用的预定义集成内容

同时兼顾现代技术栈和传统SAP架构：

  • 支持REST、GraphQL等现代API标准
  • 保持对SAP GUI、WebService等传统接口的完美兼容
  • 通过云连接器安全打通本地SAP系统与云端应用

 

SAP集成套件该怎么用呢？

对于不同规模的企业，集成套件的应用场景各有侧重：

中小型企业：可以采用集成套件作为企业服务总线，统一管理所有系统间的数据交换，建立标准化的集成治理体系。

大型企业：面临多云、混合云的复杂架构：

  • 可以进一步利用API管理功能，通过统一的API网关管理数百个服务接口
  • 可以进一步利用B2B功能，和上下游企业对接，无需邮件/电话即可实时获取供给/需求的状态
  • 可以利用事件驱动能力，将S/4HANA为代表的SAP应用作为事件源，无需代码开发，仅配置就可以实现真正的完全实时集成, 任何新的变化都可以让其他系统最快获知，进而赋予业务部门竞争优势（而不是通过定时任务或短时间轮询达成的假实时）

关于本文内容有任何问题或见解，欢迎在评论区留下你的想法，如果时间紧迫，也可以直接联系到我 arthuryang1996@foxmail.com，感谢你的时间

entry.title: Looking for Interview Partners for my Master's Thesis about Migrating to SAP S/4HANA
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

For my master's thesis at IU International University of Applied Sciences, I am looking for SAP experts who would like to share their experiences with the migration to SAP S/4HANA.

What is it about? I want to find out which challenges occur during the migration to SAP S/4HANA and how these can be overcome. The goal is to create a practical guide that supports companies in a successful migration. The focus is on the metal and electrical industry.

Participation Requirements:

  • Practical experience with the migration to SAP S/4HANA in the metal and electrical industry
  • It doesn't matter what role you had in the project

The interview will take place online, can be held in german or english and takes approximately 45 minutes of your time. The results will be fully anonymized.

If you are interested in participating in an interview, please feel free to send me a message. I truly appreciate any support!

I look forward to interesting conversations!

Best regards,

Lukas Sauter

entry.title: SAP TechEd Berlin 2025 | Real-time data for AI agents: Grounding with event-driven architecture
entry.content:
A couple of words about me: 

My name is Sunny Kapoor and I am a lead product manager for the cloud integration capability of SAP Integration Suite, specializing in enterprise-wide business process integration and digital transformation. With 15 years of professional experience, I offer a comprehensive understanding of both technical implementation and strategic product oversight.

My Session: 

IN162 | Real-time data for AI agents: Grounding with event-driven architecture | Tuesday, Nov 4 | 10:00 AM - 12:00 PM CET

What you will learn about: 

This session introduces attendees to the power of event-driven integration pattern to deliver real-time grounding data, equipping AI system's with the latest business context to make informed and accurate decisions.

AI Grounding is the process of connecting an AI system's abstract knowledge and responses to specific, real-world data and context, reducing "hallucinations" and increasing the reliability and accuracy of its outputs.

 
This session focuses into the advanced realm of real-time vector grounding, where you'll connect structured enterprise data to a large language model using SAP HANA Cloud’s vector database, SAP Integration Suite, and Advanced Event Mesh. Experience firsthand how dynamic data updates can enhance the model's responses in real time, maintaining their contextual precision. By session's end, you'll have constructed an end-to-end, event-driven flow that responds to new sales order events from SAP S/4HANA Cloud and support case events from SAP Service Cloud Version 2, providing an AI assistant with live contextual intelligence. This hands-on scenario simulates an AI-powered Customer Success Digital Assistant, equipping it with real-time sales and support data to deliver accurate insights and informed decision-making capabilities.

Co-speakers:

Prashant Gautam, Senior Product Manager, has been with SAP since 2004. With strong focus on innovation, he works on advancing Artificial Intelligence capabilities in SAP Integration Suite, driving efficiency and modernisation in integration space.

 

Karsten Strothmann is lead product manager and evangelist for event-driven integration at SAP SE in Walldorf, Germany. With over 25 years of experience in the software industry, he has extensively focused on Event-Driven Architecture (EDA) and its implementation at the enterprise level.

 

Piyush Gakhar heads the cross product management & strategy for Integration solutions such as SAP Integration Suite, API Management, Event Mesh & SAP Process Orchestration.

 

Other related sessions I recommend:  

You can also gain some further knowledge around SAP Integration Suite and SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh by attending the following SAP TechEd sessions:

  • IN103 | Helping systems talk smarter with a flexible event-driven architecture
    • Deep Dive
    • When: Wednesday, Nov 5 | 2:15 PM - 3:00 PM CET
  • IN165 | Experience event-driven integration with advanced event mesh
    • Hands-on Workshop
    • When: Thursday, Nov 6 | 11:30 AM - 1:30 PM CET
  • IN160 | Empower your business through enterprise automation
    • Hands-on Workshop
    • When: Wednesday, Nov 5 | 10:30 AM - 12:30 PM CET
  • IN163 | Implement exactly once in-order delivery in SAP Integration Suite
    • Hands-on Workshop
    • When: Wednesday, Nov 5 | 3:30 PM - 5:30 PM CET

Related community topic pages: 

  •  SAP Integration Suite
  • Joule 

Looking forward to seeing you: 

Join to learn how event-driven integration patterns can keep AI systems contextually aware and up-to-date with the latest business information.

Now let’s hear from you:

We’d love to hear your thoughts on the concept of real-time data grounding using evet-driven architecture. Share your insights and ideas by answering these questions in the comments below:

  • In what ways do you think real-time vector grounding can enhance the capabilities of AI Agents.
  • How do you plan to apply the skills and knowledge gained from this workshop to your ongoing or future projects?

Let's start a conversation and learn from each other's perspectives! 

Don't forget to register for the workshop to secure your spot and join us for this hands-on learning experience!

entry.title: Bridging AI Context and Enterprise Intelligence: The Perplexity MCP Server on SAP BTP
entry.content:
Disclaimer: The insights shared in this blog are based on my personal observations and learning. They may not apply universally, and I encourage readers to conduct their own research and make an informed decision before using this content for productive use.

Introduction

As enterprises increasingly adopt generative AI and contextual reasoning in their digital landscapes, enabling real-time knowledge access within enterprise agents becomes a key differentiator.
This blog introduces the Perplexity Ask MCP Server, an implementation based on Perplexity.ai’s Model Context Protocol (MCP), adapted to run natively on the SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP).

The integration connects SAP’s conversational agents with live web information through the Sonar API, enabling intelligent, contextual responses within enterprise-grade environments — while maintaining the governance, security, and extensibility standards of SAP BTP.

Understanding the Perplexity Ask MCP Server

The Perplexity Ask MCP Server is a middleware component that enables AI-driven agents to perform live, contextual queries via the Sonar API.
It follows the Model Context Protocol (MCP), a standardized communication protocol for exchanging contextual messages between AI models, tools, and external systems.

Core Capabilities

  • Real-time conversational access to live web information using the Sonar API.
  • Secure user authentication and authorization with SAP XSUAA.
  • Native deployment and scalability on SAP BTP Cloud Foundry.
  • Stream-based communication aligned with MCP specifications.

Enhancements for SAP BTP Integration

To ensure operational compatibility and compliance within the SAP ecosystem, the MCP server was adapted with several key architectural and deployment enhancements:

 

Enhancement AreaDescription
Runtime Compatibility

Adjusted to build and run natively on SAP BTP Cloud Foundry.

Transport Layer

Implemented streamable HTTP transport to align with the MCP Server.

Server Integration

Optimized for automatic discovery and registration within the MCP Server environment.

Endpoint

Introduced explicit endpoint /rest/mcp/streaming as defined in MCP Server documentation.

Security Integrated SAP XSUAA service for OAuth2-based user authentication and authorization.
 

Available Tools

The Perplexity Ask MCP Server provides a set of smart tools that help enterprise agents find information, answer questions, and perform reasoning tasks in real time. Each tool uses a different Sonar model from Perplexity to support specific types of queries and use cases.

  • perplexity_search
    Searches the live web using the Perplexity Search API and returns organized results with useful details.
    Best for: finding up-to-date information quickly.

  • perplexity_ask
    A conversational AI tool powered by the sonar-pro model. It can answer general questions and combine web search results to give clear, contextual responses.
    Best for: everyday questions and quick conversations.

  • perplexity_research
    Uses the sonar-deep-research model to collect and summarize information from multiple web sources for deeper understanding.
    Best for: research reports, detailed analysis, and exploring complex topics.

  • perplexity_reason
    Built on the sonar-reasoning-pro model, this tool focuses on logic and problem-solving. It helps analyze situations and suggest reasoned conclusions.
    Best for: complex problem-solving, decision-making, and critical reasoning tasks.

The perplexity_ask Tool

The perplexity_ask tool provides a simple yet powerful interface for conversational agents to perform live web searches via the Sonar API.

{
  "messages": [
    {
      "role": "system" | "user" | "assistant",
      "content": "Message text here"
    }
  ]
}

Each message in the array represents a conversational turn, which the MCP server forwards to the Sonar API for processing.
Responses are streamed back to the client through the MCP interface, maintaining context awareness throughout the interaction.

 

Deployment and Configuration on SAP BTP

Step 1. Obtain a Sonar API Key

  1. Sign up for a Sonar API account.
  2. Generate an API key from the developer dashboard.
  3. Optionally, use a shared API key if available within your project landscape.

Step 2. Build and Deploy the MCP Server on Cloud Foundry

Prerequisites

  • SAP BTP subaccount with Cloud Foundry environment enabled.

  • A configured CF space for deployment.

Deployment Steps

  1. Clone and Install Dependencies

git clone <repository-url>
cd perplexity-ask
npm install

2. Build the Project 

npm run build

3. Create XSUAA Service Instance

cf create-service xsuaa application perplexity-mcp-xsuaa -c xs-security.json
cf create-service-key perplexity-mcp-xsuaa <service-key-name>

4. Deploy the Application

cf push

5. Configure the Sonar API Key

cf set-env perplexity-mcp-server PERPLEXITY_API_KEY "<your_api_key>"
cf restage perplexity-mcp-server

Once deployment is complete, verify that the application status is running and healthy (cf apps).

 

Step 3. Create SAP BTP Destination

To enable communication between Agents and the MCP Server, create a destination in the SAP BTP Cockpit.

Retrieve XSUAA Credentials

Use the following command to fetch the required credentials:

cf service-key perplexity-mcp-xsuaa <service-key-name>

 

Configure Destination
| Field                 | Value                                                                           |
| --------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Name**              | PERPLEXITYMCP                                                                   |
| **Type**              | HTTP                                                                            |
| **URL**               | `https://<your-app-route>.cfapps.<region>.hana.ondemand.com/rest/mcp/streaming` |
| **Proxy Type**        | Internet                                                                        |
| **Authentication**    | OAuth2ClientCredentials                                                         |
| **Client ID**         | `<clientid from XSUAA service key>`                                             |
| **Client Secret**     | `<clientsecret from XSUAA service key>`                                         |
| **Token Service URL** | `<authentication_url>/oauth/token`                                              |

 

 

Step 4. Register the MCP Server in Agents

With the destination in place, register the MCP server as a tool within Agents.

| Field            | Value                                             |
| ---------------- | ------------------------------------------------- |
| **Server Name** | PerplexityMCP                                     |
| **Description**  | MCP server for live web reasoning using Sonar API |
| **Destination**  | PERPLEXITYMCP                                     |

Once deployed, the mcp server should automatically display the available MCP tools — including perplexity_ask — in the cockpit.
This confirms successful registration and readiness for use with Agents.

 

Interaction Flow

  1. The Agent MCP Server routes the conversation to the MCP Server via the configured destination.
  2. The MCP Server communicates with the Sonar API for live, web-based reasoning.
  3. Responses are streamed back to the Business Agent for contextual display.

 

Security and Compliance Considerations

Security is a core design principle in the integration of the Perplexity Ask MCP Server within SAP BTP. The implementation fully adheres to SAP’s enterprise-grade standards for identity management, data protection, and secure communication.

1. Authentication and Authorization

User authentication and service authorization are managed through SAP XSUAA (X.509-based SAP Authorization and Trust Management Service). The implementation leverages the OAuth 2.0 Client Credentials flow to ensure that only authorized applications and tools within the SAP BTP landscape can access the MCP server. This guarantees secure token-based access and prevents unauthorized invocation of APIs.

2. Secure Communication and Transport

The MCP Server communicates using streamable HTTP, as outlined in the Agent MCP Server specification. This transport mechanism provides a reliable, bidirectional, and low-latency channel for message exchange between the Agent and the MCP Server, ensuring data integrity and confidentiality throughout the interaction.

3. Multi-Tenant Data Isolation

The deployment follows SAP BTP’s multi-tenant security model, which enforces tenant isolation at the application and data layers. Each tenant operates within a securely isolated runtime context, ensuring that no cross-tenant access occurs. This design aligns with SAP’s compliance framework for enterprise applications deployed on BTP.

4. Compliance Alignment

By leveraging SAP-managed services such as XSUAA and adhering to BTP’s runtime security standards, the solution maintains compliance with SAP’s data protection, privacy, and regulatory guidelines. 

Conclusion

The integration of the Perplexity Ask MCP Server with SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) demonstrates the platform’s strength in securely hosting and scaling AI-driven workloads while upholding SAP’s governance, trust, and compliance principles.

This architecture lays the foundation for Agentic AI ecosystems on SAP BTP, where intelligent agents can autonomously interact, reason, and take contextual actions within business processes. The result is a more adaptive, insight-driven enterprise that empowers customers and partners to accelerate innovation with secure, scalable, and compliant AI integration.

entry.title: Re: Extracting data from SAP BW/4HANA, is HANA Runtime DB sufficient?
entry.content:
HANA Runtime Database is mainly used to run SAP applications like SAP BW/4HANA, not to do all kinds of data extraction or analysis work.

If your goal is just to keep BW/4HANA working — like storing, processing, and managing data that your reports use ,then the HANA Runtime DB is enough. It supports the internal data models and calculations that BW needs to operate smoothly.

But if you want to extract data from BW/4HANA to use in other tools, systems, or analytics platforms, you’ll often need more than just the Runtime license. You might need a HANA Enterprise Edition or HANA Full Use license, depending on how you plan to access and use that data.

The main difference is:

  • Runtime license – only allows use of HANA for SAP applications (like BW/4HANA).

  • Full license – allows you to build your own models, extract data freely, or connect non-SAP tools.

So, if you only need BW reports, Runtime DB is fine.
If you want to pull data out for broader analysis, you’ll need more access than the Runtime license provides.

entry.title: Re: IPS: Global User ID
entry.content:
Hello again, @tskwin,
Not all SAP solutions are ready to store and use the global user ID. You can "infer" this from the target transformation code syntax, e.g., compare SAC and BTP ABAP environment under Target Systems | SAP Help Portal  (search for userUuid). However, this source of information can be misleading, since these default transformations may contain future enhancements (things that are not yet active, as far as I understand).

However, this global user id can be part of the session token if added as attribute in your application definition in CIS. Now, its does not mean it will be used by the app... Another hint: an SAP solution that brags about the magic of Joule 😁 will certainly need the global user id at some point.
Now, back to your userName question, that is a different one: you must follow the constraints of how the userName can be defined in SAC (and Datasphere), you cannot use all sorts of characters, and only 20, etc. But this userName is not the userUuid (at all). It is up to you to create it so that it is unique, has 20 characters, etc. (see my previous response).
Last "trick" (there are so many, for IPS, since SAP did not do us the favor to add a "debug mode" to it): if you want to understand what you need to put in all fields in a target transformation, I recommend you create a script that uses the SCIM API to collect data from the target - from SAC, in your case. You need to refer to Getting Started | SAP Help Portal, create an OAuth cilent for API Access using Client Credentials, etc. You may find useful info about that here (this is for Datasphere but both are very similar): Comprehensive Overview: SCIM API for SAP Dataspher... - SAP Community
Bonus: below is a PowerShell script to collect SAC Teams, you can change it easily to retrieve users (adjust the url based on your configuration).
Good luck!

# Step 1: Get Access Token
$clientId = "your_client_id_as_created_in_SAC"
$clientSecret = 'your_client_secret_as_created_in_SAC'
$tokenUrl = "https://your_tenant_name.authentication.us20.hana.ondemand.com/oauth/token"

# Prepare body as form-url-encoded
$body = @{
    grant_type = "client_credentials"
    client_id = $clientId
    client_secret = $clientSecret
}

# Convert to form-url-encoded content
$tokenResponse = Invoke-RestMethod -Method Post -Uri $tokenUrl `
    -ContentType "application/x-www-form-urlencoded" `
    -Body $body

$accessToken = $tokenResponse.access_token

# Step 2: Retrieve Groups via SCIM
$scimUrl = "https://your_tenant_name.us20.hcs.cloud.sap/api/v1/scim2/Groups"

$userResponse = Invoke-RestMethod -Method Get -Uri $scimUrl `
    -Headers @{
        Authorization = "Bearer $accessToken"
        "x-sap-sac-custom-auth" = "true"
    }

# Step 3: Output JSON-formatted user data
$userResponse | ConvertTo-Json -Depth 10

entry.title: Re: Wrong material valuation - correction?
entry.content:
Hello @Pavel_Prt 

Thank you for your question.

Here are some recommended references for more details.

Adjust Inventory Balance Sheet Accounts - Delta Posting, MATERIAL LEDGER in S/4HANA

Material price differences between ledgers, In-Depth with SAP S/4HANA – Ledger Scoping Q&A

To summarise, in public cloud, the Material Ledger inconsistency between cost estimate values and the actual valuation data stored under accounting 1 tab you have described can occur if:

  • The defined price unit or costing lot size was not consistently converted during material price update
  • The valuation data wasn’t refreshed across ledgers/currencies after costing release, or
  • Certain ledgers were excluded from price transfer during material valuation update.

Since the re-costing corrected future prices, you only need to fix the historical valuation differences. I suggest you run the Delta Posting app for the ledgers and materials that were affected. It will create adjustments without changing your cost estimates.

You may consider the following option to resolve the issue:

Open the  Delta Posting  app -->

Enter the valuation area/plant and material --> select your Ledger Group (e.g., 0L)

The system will calculate delta values for mismatched ledgers/currencies. Thereafter, post the adjustment entry to correct balance sheet and inventory accounts.

Note, this app adjusts G/L valuation postings only, it does not alter your costing data or cost estimates.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: PO numbering
entry.content: Hey! You don’t necessarily need a separate document type for each company. A common approach is to use **number ranges per company code** for the same PO document type. That way, each company gets its own sequential numbering, but you avoid the hassle of maintaining 20+ document types. If you need more advanced control, you can also use a **BAdI or user-exit** (like `ME_DOCUMENT_BADI`) to tweak numbering or add checks programmatically. Keeps things simpler but still meets the requirement. If you want, I can explain step by step how to set up the number ranges for each company.

entry.title: My Journey in the SAP World: From Curiosity to Passion
entry.content:
Since the beginning of my career, SAP has always been more than just a technology platform — it has been a space to learn, grow, and connect business with innovation.

I started working with SAP at a very young age, and what began as curiosity quickly became a true passion. Over the years, I’ve had the opportunity to explore different areas and witness firsthand how SAP has evolved — from traditional ERP systems to today’s intelligent, data-driven, cloud-based solutions.

Working in SAP has taught me that technology is only one part of the story. The real value comes from understanding business processes, connecting with people, and translating challenges into solutions that make a measurable impact.

What excites me the most today is how  SAP’s intelligent technologies — from AI and automation to advanced analytics — are transforming Finance and helping organizations make smarter, faster decisions. It’s inspiring to see how SAP continues to evolve, and how we, as professionals, can evolve with it.

Through this space, I’d like to share my experiences, insights, and lessons learned throughout my SAP journey — hoping to inspire others who, like me, believe in the power of continuous learning and innovation.

Let’s keep growing together in this amazing SAP ecosystem!

#SAPCommunity #SAPCareer ##SAPS4HANA ##WomenInTech  #DigitalTransformation

entry.title: Re: installation issue
entry.content:
Regarding to the message "restricted to corresponding installation", kindly note that is not a error but rather a notification that the corresponding authorization "display service requests" is limited to the installation level *. 

Regarding to Authorization level, please refer to KBA 1898762 - What are the different S-user ID authorization levels that can be assigned? - SAP for Me.

Regarding to your issue, the "display service requests " set on CCC level for * but set on installation level for *. This mean* has the highest level of this authorization, which is why the message is not shown for this S-user. 

If you do not want this message is shown for *, you can update the authorization for CCC level as the *.

Hope my answer could be clarified.

Thanks and best regards,

SAP Support

entry.title: SAP Build 拓展套件概况介绍
entry.content:
如果您对BTP感兴趣，BTP个人精选内容目录 | SAP Blogs 可能有更多你需要的内容

 

SAP Build是什么，它从何而来？

SAP Build是SAP推出的拓展平台，作为SAP BTP（业务技术平台）的核心组件，包含了低代码、专业代码和生成式AI开发能力。该平台旨在为SAP客户提供一站式的开发解决方案。同时，由于SAP近来推行的清洁核心Clean Core战略 ，该平台也变得越来越重要，将作为IT架构中承载定制化需求的敏捷平台来为保持标准化的应用保驾护航。

 

SAP开发Build的目的是什么？

降低开发门槛，加速数字化创新：

现代企业面临着快速变化的业务需求和日益复杂的技术环境。传统的应用开发方式需要大量编程知识和技术专长，开发周期长、成本高。SAP Build通过提供直观的拖拽式界面、预构建模板和简化的开发工具，让业务用户也能快速创建企业级应用，大幅缩短从想法到实现的时间。

充分释放SAP应用价值：

SAP Build与SAP S/4HANA、SAP SuccessFactors等SAP应用天然集成，仅需配置即可完成对接，更提供预定义的连接器和集成模板，帮助企业更好地扩展现有SAP投资，实现数据和流程的无缝连接。

 

SAP Build由什么组成，可以用来干什么？

SAP Build主要包含四个核心组件，形成完整的开发生态系统：

  • SAP Build Apps：低代码应用开发平台，通过拖拽方式快速开发前后端和数据结构，更是可以一次开发，多次部署成Web和移动应用，无需深度编程知识 。
  • SAP Build Code：专业代码开发环境，集成了生成式AI助手Joule，适合专业开发人员使用。
  • SAP Build Process Automation：流程自动化工具，拖拉拽即可开发RPA和工作流，帮助企业提高运营效率。
  • SAP Build Work Zone：低代码的门户平台，为员工、合作伙伴和客户提供统一的应用入口。

所有组件通过统一的SAP Build Lobby进行管理，支持组件间的无缝协作和资源共享，包括UX组件、工作流、数据模型和业务逻辑的复用。除此之外，未来还将包括Joule Studio，用于承接AI助手Joule的定制化需求。

 

SAP Build该怎么用呢？

SAP Build作为全面的开发平台，对不同的场景都提供了灵活的开发方式：

  • 对于流程自动化方面的需求，可以通过Process Automation自动化/数字化运营流程，如发票处理、审批流程等，显著提升运营效率
  • 对于用户单一入口的需求：可以使用Work Zone创建统一的数字工作空间，整合各类业务应用和信息资源
  • 对于应用开发类的需求：对于相对简单，上线要求紧张的需求，可以使用Build Apps通过拖拉拽快速开发；对于复杂的需求，可以使用SAP Build Code借助生成式AI的能力生成代码，快速构建复杂的全栈应用

但最关键的还是在应用开发部分，所有SAP应用的定制开发需求最后都会流向SAP Build这个产品，也就是说，标准的核心保持标准，敏捷的平台快速迭代。

 

 

关于本文内容有任何问题或见解，欢迎在评论区留下你的想法，如果时间紧迫，也可以直接联系到我 arthuryang1996@foxmail.com，感谢你的时间

entry.title: Re: SAP SMS Configuration
entry.content:
Great and detailed guide on setting up SMS configuration through SCOT and HTTP in SAP! 👍

For those working on ABAP development and wanting to trigger SMS directly from a program, you can use the standard SAP program SE38: SWN_TEST_SEND_SMS1.
This program internally uses the CL_BCS class for message sending — you can either execute it directly for testing or copy it as a reference for your own custom development.

After execution, you can verify the sent messages in transaction SOST.
This approach is beneficial for validating the configuration before integrating SMS functionality into custom ABAP reports or workflows.

entry.title: Questions regarding SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition functionalities
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,
We are considering SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition and have several questions regarding standard functionalities. Any insights would be greatly appreciated.


1. Cost Driver Units
We understand that "time" is available as a cost driver unit. What other units are available as standard options in Public Cloud?
2. Product Costing - List Display
Is it possible to display actual costing and standard costing for multiple materials in a list view?
3. Inventory Valuation
We understand that standard functions include valuation for slow-moving stock and lowest value principle. Is this correct? Is excess stock valuation also available as a standard function?
4. G/L Account Input Control
Is it possible to control G/L account input by user, especially for manufacturing costs and SG&A accounts? Can this be achieved through mechanisms such as cost center-based account assignment restrictions?
5. Fixed Asset Mass Change
Is there a standard function for mass upload/change of fixed asset master data in Public Cloud? If not, is there an API available?
6. Internal Order Alternative in Public Cloud
We understand that Internal Orders are not available in Public Cloud.
Currently, we use two types of settlement mechanisms:

Type A: Using balance sheet accounts (e.g., advances, work in process) with cost collection capability
Type B: Using P&L accounts (e.g., miscellaneous losses, cost variances) without cost collection

Both types allow goods movements from inventory.
Can WBS elements replicate these functionalities? If not, what are the alternative approaches in Public Cloud?
7. Liquidity Management
Could you provide an explanation or documentation of the Liquidity Management (Cash Flow Management) functionality in Public Cloud?
8. Asset Accounting & Investment Management
We manage investment projects including transfers from assets under construction (AuC) to completed assets, tracking balances per investment project.
Without Internal Orders in Public Cloud, how should we handle asset accounting & investment management? Are there any documentation or best practice guides available?

Thank you in advance for your support.

Note: We have 8 specific questions listed above. When responding, please reference the question number (e.g., "Re: Question 1", "Re: Question 3") so we can clearly track which questions have been addressed. We would greatly appreciate responses to all questions if possible.

For questions asking "Is it possible?", please also provide the specific implementation method (e.g., App ID, Fiori app name, configuration path, API name, etc.) if the answer is "Yes".

entry.title: SAP Business Data Cloud业务数据云概况介绍
entry.content:
如果您对BTP感兴趣，BTP个人精选内容目录 | SAP Blogs 可能有更多你需要的内容

 

SAP Business Data Cloud是什么，它从何而来？

SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC)是SAP推出的统一数据管理和分析平台，基于SAP Business Technology Platform构建，提供数据统一和分析能力。定位是SAP在数据驱动时代的核心数据平台，基于云原生架构打造，融入了SAP在企业数据管理和业务洞察领域的深厚积累。

 

SAP开发Business Data Cloud的目的是什么？

1. 为客户提供统一的数据平台：

BDC提供了功能全面的一站式解决方案，帮助客户减少架构设计和实施的成本，可以快速获取完整的数据能力。

2. 帮助客户降低SAP数据的使用成本：

BDC通过预构建的数据集成，存储，建模，可视化内容，自动化处理数据提取、转换和发布，让企业能够快速获得可信赖的、分析就绪的数据，用户只需要挑选并点击启用报表，系统就会自动完成所有配置工作，为用户快速提供基于实时数据的报表

3.帮助SAP老客户快速应用最新技术：

BDC通过BW PCE组件来帮助SAP老客户保留过去的投资，同时以最小的颠覆性提供使用新技术例如Databricks的方式，

 

SAP Business Data Cloud由什么组成，可以用来干什么？

BDC为企业提供完整的数据管理和分析能力，主要包括数据集成与治理、数据存储与建模、数据分析与可视化、AI与机器学习四大核心能力。

BDC基于云原生SaaS架构设计，包含以下核心组件：

  • BDC Cockpit：统一管理界面，用于配置数据管道、管理用户访问和监控系统状态
  • SAP Datasphere：提供数据集成，存储，建模能力
  • SAP Analytics Cloud：提供分析和可视化功能
  • SAP Databricks：提供高级数据工程和机器学习能力
  • SAP BW PCE：保留企业过去对BW的投资，并应用到最新技术

 

BDC有两种用法：

一种是基于预置SaaS报表的快速启动方式：通过BDC Cockpit选择并启用SaaS报表后，系统就会自动从SAP S/4HANA等源系统提取数据，在Datasphere中创建数据模型，然后在SAP Analytics Cloud中生成实时数据的报表

一种是自定义方式：从数据集成，数据存储，数据建模到数据展示，BDC支持全部组件的定制开发，用户可以根据自己的需求从零开始开发，当然也可以复制一份标准内容之后再进行定制化修改

 

SAP Business Data Cloud和市面上常见的类似产品有什么区别？

1. 开箱即用的标准SaaS报表： 与通用数据平台不同，BDC提供预构建的SaaS报表，专门针对SAP业务场景设计。企业无需从零开始构，可以直接使用标准化的成品报表，大幅缩短实施周期。

2. 基于BTP的平台效应： BDC充分利用SAP BTP的统一身份认证、安全管理和监控能力，各个组件之间可以无缝协作。数据在不同组件间流转时保持一致性和安全性，避免了传统多厂商集成的复杂性。

3. 与SAP生态的深度集成： BDC原生支持SAP应用的数据模型和业务逻辑，包括对S/4HANA、SuccessFactors、Ariba等SAP应用的深度集成。同时支持第三方数据源，通过统一的数据模型实现跨系统的数据一致性。

 

SAP Business Data Cloud该怎么用呢？

对于不同数据成熟度的企业，BDC的应用重点各有不同：

数据起步阶段的企业： 可以从SaaS报表开始，快速获得业务洞察。例如使用People Intelligence应用分析人力资源数据，或使用S/4HANA数据包分析财务和运营数据。

数据整合阶段的企业： 可以重点利用BDC的数据集成能力，将分散在各个系统中的数据统一到Datasphere中，建立企业级的数据仓库和数据湖架构。

数据驱动阶段的企业： 可以充分利用BDC的高级分析能力：

  • 通过Databricks进行复杂的机器学习和AI分析，预测业务趋势
  • 利用跨系统的统一数据模型，实现真正的端到端业务洞察
  • 在复杂的多云、混合云环境中提供一致的数据体验，让业务决策始终基于最新、最准确的数据（而不是依赖传统的批处理或手工报表方式）

 

 

 

关于本文内容有任何问题或见解，欢迎在评论区留下你的想法，如果时间紧迫，也可以直接联系到我 arthuryang1996@foxmail.com，感谢你的时间

entry.title: Re: Automatic accrual creation
entry.content: In Time Off calendar, can you able to view the auto accrual job created for the required time account type? If it is scheduled/created, click and view the information. The job will validate the target population whose anniversary date is matching on the time off calendar run date. If the anniversary date matches then accrual will execute and show the count of target population in the job else it will be showing as "0".

entry.title: Re: RFQ
entry.content:
Hi Dinesh, 

You should be able to change delivery dates in quotation directly as quoted by supplier? Is you do not see it as editable, someone might have made it a display field in screen configuration for the transaction. 

To add warranty fields, you need to use any unused field in quotation or add custom fields in RFQ using BADI which will also appear in quotation. 

Hope this helps

Warm regards, Ramki

entry.title: Changing Functional Area in Cost Center Master After Postings — Impact
entry.content:
Dear SAP Experts,

We are currently reviewing a scenario in our SAP S/4HANA system (module: CO-FM Integration) where a Cost Center that has been active for over a year — and has many posted transactions — needs to have its Functional Area (FAREA) changed in the master data (KS02).

The cost center is linked to Funds Management (FM) via derivation rules (FMDERIVE) and is also part of Cost-of-Sales P&L reporting by Functional Area.

What system impacts and discrepancies can occur if we change the Functional Area in a Cost Center master that already has historical transactions?

Specifically:

  1. How will this affect historical vs. future postings (in FI / CO)?

  2. Will Funds Management (FM) derive the new Functional Area automatically, and how does it impact budget and commitment tracking?

  3. Will there be any reporting inconsistencies in Cost of Sales P&L or Segment / Functional Reporting?

  4. Are there any SAP Notes or recommended procedures to handle such a change safely (e.g., new cost center creation, reclassification, or FMDERIVE adjustment)?

#CO (Controlling) #FundsManagement #PublicSectorManagement #FunctionalArea #S4HANA #BestPractices

entry.title: Report showing the remaining quantity on PO blocked lines
entry.content:
In the Purchasing Document per Project application, the report currently displays a quantity of "0" in the To Be Delivered field for purchase order (PO) lines that are blocked, even if goods receipts (GRs) have previously been posted for those lines. We are seeking a solution to accurately reflect the actual remaining quantity for blocked lines in a format that can be exported to Excel.

 

 

 

Desired Report Output

 

We are seeking a report that includes the following fields:

 

  • PO Number
  • Line Number
  • Document Date
  • Supplier Name and Number
  • Buyer Number
  • Short Text
  • WBS Element
  • Order Quantity
  • Still to be Delivered Quantity
  • Deletion Indicator

 

 

 

Current Solution:

 

We are currently using the “Purchasing Documents per Project” app to extract this data. While the app provides most of the required information, we’ve identified a limitation.

 

For any line items that are deleted or closed (as indicated by the deletion indicator), the report does not retain the quantity received prior to the closure or deletion.

 

Example:

 

If a line originally had a quantity of $10,000 and was closed after receiving $6,000, the report incorrectly reflects that no invoices were applied to that line.

 

Request:

 

We need the report to accurately reflect all payments or receipts made against a line, even if the line has subsequently been closed or deleted.


--- Steps to Reproduce ---

Current Solution:

 

We are currently using the “Purchasing Documents per Project” app to extract this data. While the app provides most of the required information, we’ve identified a limitation.

 

For any line items that are deleted or closed (as indicated by the deletion indicator), the report does not retain the quantity received prior to the closure or deletion.

Kind Regards

entry.title: Re: Report showing the remaining quantity on PO blocked l...
entry.content:
Dear Customer,

Thank you for your detailed request.

We understand that you would like the report to accurately reflect all goods receipts and invoice payments made against a purchase order line, even if the line item has subsequently been closed or deleted.

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, the behavior you observe is as designed. Once a PO line is marked as closed or deleted, the standard “Purchasing Documents per Project” app dynamically updates the “To Be Delivered” field to zero, since no further deliveries are expected. As a result, previously received or invoiced quantities are not retained in this field.

Once a line item is marked for deletion or closed, the system assumes no further deliveries are expected and therefore does not retain the historical quantity in the “To Be Delivered” field

you may explore the CDS views : https://api.sap.com/

If you prefer a standard app, you can review the “Monitor Purchase Order Items” (App ID: F0843A), which provides detailed GR/IR information, though it may not include all project-related fields.

 

Thanks

SAP SUPPORT
